lexUnit.name: leak.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of liquid, gas, etc.) pass in or out through a hole or crack in such a way.

sentence.text: Blood leaked out of his mouth , but nothing else .
So a black eye starts off red , and it starts off red because of the blood leaked into the skin .
There is blood leaking from the back of the man 's head , beneath the red hair .
Saunders ' body was twitching violently as his blood leaked out in dying jets , slicking the walkway .
Pollution experts from the National Rivers Authority were called in to assess the danger of fuel leaking into the canal .
Conoca said : ` A leak has developed inside one well of the unmanned platform and gas is leaking up to the surface .

Shipping , including Isle of Wight ferry and hydrofoil crossings , was halted on Southampton Water last night after inert gas leaked from the tanker Mobil Petrel as it discharged crude oil at the Fawley Esso oil refinery .
Burning oil which had leaked from the tanker , the Agip Abruzzo , engulfed the ferry and all except one of the ferry 's crew and passengers were burned to death or drowned .
The uncertainty principle would allow particles and radiation to leak out of the black hole at a steady rate .
A spokesman in Moscow said the Russian craft suffered minimal damage and no radiation leaked after the accident on Saturday .
On 22 August , 2,000 fish were killed when chlorinated water from a council swimming pool leaked into the river .
They ran out and , shutting the door behind them , blocked the gaps around it with a torn sheet to stop the water leaking out into the corridor .
Sea water leaked from his mouth , his breath gasped in jerky spasms .
Water is leaking through our ceiling from the waste outlet of the shower tray in the bathroom above .
Good quality draincocks have a gland which prevents water leaking around the top of the fitting when it is open .
Firemen from Thornaby and Stockton swilled away an amount of petrol leaking from a car in Yarm Street , Stockton .
A fine trickle of drool leaked from the corner of his mouth .
During laparotomy , 2 cm of more proximal bile duct was missing and bile leaked from the common hepatic duct into the abdominal cavity , explaining the absence of obstructive jaundice .
Soil and water in the Yosemite national park in California are polluted with toxic chemicals which have been leaking from underground fuel tanks for decades .
It is likely to be frightened in the dark , and there is always the possibility of exhaust fumes leaking into this compartment , sometimes with deadly effects .
Some 9,000 tonnes of molasses leaked into the Nam Pong river in mid-March , subsequently spreading to the Chee and Mool .
As long as the hole remains clear of debris , if a pipe should split , air leaking into the system through the hole should limit any mess and prevent an accident from turning into a catastrophe .
Soon the smoke began to leak through her clothes until the ensuing fog convinced me as always that she would set herself alight .
But the ink often leaked through the screws and damaged clothing .
News of the changed disposal plans came in an internal University memo leaked to The Guardian newspaper .
Had word of Hanson 's interest leaked to the market , the stockbroker 's chutzpah could almost have bankrupted the firm .
She turned to face him and he saw how her skin was shivering , the self-control leaking out of the corners of her eyes , her face breaking up .
Tears leaked out of his eyes .
And also in the house is the Monster , Mr Whistle , obscene drool leaking onto his embroidered vest .
It is presumed that ivalon injected to plug the liver biopsy leaked intraperitoneally and caused the foreign body reaction seen .
Limp orange light was leaking in around the edges of a grey blind .
